host.name: Monarc Gaming Labs
host.misc: Parking is available on the street

speakers.title: PhantomJS Under the Hood.
speakers.name: Buddy Sandidge
speakers.description: This talk goes into lessons learned from writing a sizeable PhantomJS application. We'll examine the architecture of the PhantomJS application itself and what the implications are for developers. We'll also look at best practices for using 3rd party libraries and running unit tests.

speakers.title: Monitoring Applications with StatsD
speakers.name: Advait Shinde
speakers.description: StatsD is a generic, lightweight, flexible protocol/daemon that allows you to keep track of application-specific time series metrics. It's a dead-simple approach that enables developers to instrument their applications with granular monitoring before even deploying to production.

speakers.title: Module of the Month: Request
speakers.name: Greg Cardoni
speakers.description: Module of the month is a segment that highlights one of the many npm modules that make Nodejs so great. This months module is Request

host.name: Yahoo!
host.misc: Parking is available on the street

speakers.title: Lovefield: a powerful Javascript SQL-like database query engine for the web.
speakers.name: Demetrios Papadopoulos
speakers.description: Lovefield is providing a feature rich, cross-browser database query engine built using IndexedDB as a backend. It provides an intuitive SQL-like declarative syntax and it is closing a gap in the web development ecosystem that was created by the deprecation of WebSQL back in 2010.

speakers.title: How to effortlessly integrate Three.js into your projects
speakers.name: Jason Farrell
speakers.description: This talk will focus on how to add 3D animation to real-world projects. It'll cover the basics of how to get started with Three.js, and how to build animated interactions that can be used in seemingly normal web apps.

speakers.title: Module of the Month: Sinon
speakers.name: Helior Colorado
speakers.description: Module of the month is a segment that highlights one of the many npm modules that make Node.js so great. This months module is Sinon
